main event: On October 16, 1956, in Plano, Illinois, a civilian reported seeing a round red, orange, and green object the size of a baseball at arm's length with flashing lights. The object was initially located near the observer and then moved high into the sky, remaining in sight at the time of the initial report.
interesting points: The object was described as having flashing lights and being the size of a baseball at arm's length.
Location of the sighting was near a military base, just 2 miles west.
The source of the report was a civilian, adding to the credibility of the sighting.
The report stated insufficient data for analysis, suggesting a lack of evidence or information.
The conclusion indicated 'Insufficient Data for Evaluation' with the possibility that the object was unknown.
sighted object: One round red, orange, and green object
